column1: the Mandarin was the biggest dissapointment for me. Marvel WTF have you done :'(

What an ending, What a movie. It was just fantastic

It's unfair for people to judge the movie due to the Mandarin. As a reader of the comic, though the movie does not follow the comic, the movie's plot and storyline is still really awesome and unexpected. It is a movie worth watching whether you read the comic or not.

Its kind of a mix. Iron Patriot is normally an antagonist because Norman Osbourne is in the Iron Patriot suit. Rhodes is war machine but because Osbourne is Sony's property were left with a huge character change so he is like Iron war patriot machine. :P
Not exactly everyone will love this movie.But yes it seeriously sucks.No offense

1:50 The musical transition here is just so perfect. It went from despair to hope, using the last note of a dark tone and bringing in the first note of the avengers theme. I get goosebumps watching this back because when you saw that avengers logo and hear the theme ring in, you just feel everything that had built up to this point in the MCU.

One of the cleanest trailers ever. They foreshadowed so much without us knowing he made a conversation that really never happened and just the blending of the music sound effects everything. Just an amazing trailer

It's 2023. Sometimes I still come back and re-watch these trailers, to remind myself of how unbelievably exciting this time in the MCU was. I hope I get to feel this again in my lifetime.

THIS was the MCU at its peak. The theories, the first time cross overs, thinking Cap was gonna die, seeing the GOTG mix with the Avengers and the pure might of Thanos. Nothing will top it. Star Wars of this generation.

Thanos: When I m done half of humanity will still exist
Coronavirus: My turn
This was the peak of the mcu, my god I still get pumped from watching this.

I honestly don’t believe any media will ever achieve the level of worldwide hype and anticipation that Infinity War and brought. Even as the MCU expands into phase 4 and beyond, this was truly a once in a lifetime experience

Take my money, Marvel.

As someone who was getting bored of the MCU, I was very surprised how much I enjoyed this movie. IMO the best MCU film in years.

Abomination, Dragon, Wong and the warrior dog. This movie is gonna be special. Fight sequences are looking great from now onwards.

Asian kid tryin to disobey his strict father...

Asian kids in real life: Yeah, you definitely need super powers to do that.

As a long time MCU fan, this movie added a whole new level, the same way doctor strange did. It might just be my favorite installment to date. The trailers don't do it justice!! The callbacks and cameos, the original cast, the story and the way it's all weaved together so intricately and naturally. 10/10 recommend and I can't wait to see what the future holds in store for Shang-Chi!

For everyone that doesn’t know the dragon is not Fin Fang Foom. This dragon is called The Great Protector. They chose not to have Fin Fang Foom in the film from due to racism and China. It still might be a version of him but very different.
I cannot wait for the fight scenes in this. They have such a good stunt group involved. It's going to be amazing!
At this point I just want to consume anything MCU related.

After seeing this movie, I feel like EVERY scene had a purpose. There were no 'filler' scenes, every moment contributed to its own part of the film. Even if you don't know everything about the mcu I highly recommend you watch it!
Without a doubt one of the best and most underrated MCU movies ever created.

When I first saw the trailer ,  seeing Jane got me worried,  I thought her arc will ruin the movie yet I stayed hopeful that it maybe as good as thor:ragnarok or even more , I thought thor will try to truly find himself , I thought  thor will travel the world with guardians and then gorr would be shown and Christian bale would be given justice , he played so nicely  and jane would just have a small cameo  where she got the hammer or would be like valkyrie in ragnarok and thor realizes that he doesn't need the hammer to control his power  , but they completely ruined it 🤦 the potential this movie had was destroyed
the worst film of the MCU. an absolute waste of time, energy and money. if the director doesn't care, why should we

It’s such a shame MCU completely screw up this epic storyline so badly.  Also, MCU continues to treat Asgardians like they are just weak and normal people like human when although they are far less powerful than Thor and Odin, they still are much much stronger and much more durable than most species in the universe because of their much denser physiology.  Even a regular Asgardian can lift tons and endure powerful energy blasts.  They also heal faster .  They should not be just a village of helpless folks as depicted in the movie..
Too bad this movie sucked.
no this movie has no right to live in this universe
